job_description_formatted:
Position Description

CGI is hiring a Java Technical Lead with deep expertise in Core Java, API development, batch processing, and database engineering.

We’re looking for a hands-on leader with 10+ years of Java experience, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to guide teams in building scalable, high-performing solutions.

Experience with AI-assisted development tools, collaboration across cross-functional teams, and a focus on continuous improvement are essential.

Your future duties and responsibilities

You will work in a product development and maintenance environment and be expected to:

  • Lead technical design, architecture discussions, and development across backend and full-stack components.
  • Act as a hands-on contributor: write, review, and debug code to ensure technical excellence.
  • Develop and maintain backend services using Core Java, Java/JEE, Spring Framework, and REST APIs.
  • Design and implement large-scale batch processes using Spring Batch or equivalent frameworks for performance and scalability.
  • Ensure robust database design; optimize complex SQL queries and stored procedures.
  • Provide technical leadership and mentoring to onshore and offshore teams.
  • Drive productivity improvements using AI tools and automation.
  • Build and maintain reusable frameworks and accelerators.
  • Perform code reviews and enforce coding standards for maintainability and scalability.
  • Collaborate with product, architecture, UX, and QA teams for end-to-end delivery.
  • Troubleshoot production issues, perform root cause analysis, and implement permanent fixes.
  • Contribute to Agile ceremonies, planning, and estimations.
  • Evaluate new technologies and frameworks to enhance system performance.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

10+ years of strong Java development experience, with mastery in Core Java, multithreading, and JVM fundamentals.

  • Very strong batch development experience (Spring Batch or equivalent), including high-volume, mission-critical workflows.
  • Expertise in REST API design and development using Spring Boot or similar frameworks.
  • Hands-on coding and debugging skills with willingness to dive deep into complex codebases.
  • Strong SQL capabilities including optimization and performance tuning.
  • Experience with UI frameworks such as Angular or React .
  • Proven leadership experience in technical roles.
  • Experience in onshore–offshore delivery models.
  • Strong exposure to CI/CD pipelines (Maven, Jenkins, Git, etc.).
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
  • Experience using AI productivity tools such as GitHub Copilot / Vertex AI.
  • Ability to build reusable solution components and accelerators.
  • Strong analytical, debugging, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Self-learner capable of adopting new technologies quickly through hands-on exploration.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments.

CGI is providing a reasonable estimate of the pay range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors including but not limited to skill set level, geographic market, experience and training, and licenses and certifications. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $95,000 - $145,000. This role is an existing vacancy.

job_summary: We are hiring for this position out of our Toronto office. Successful candidates who apply outside of these areas will be expected to relocate and reside in a location that is within a commutable distance. This job posting is for an existing vacancy. This is a 14-month fixed contract position. About The Role The Jr Data Analyst supports reporting across multiple lending portfolios including Single Family, Commercial, Consumer, ABL/Structured Finance, as well as deposit reporting. This role is key to running, validating, and distributing operational reports that are widely used across the organization. You’ll work closely with internal teams and external partners, ensuring data accuracy, timely delivery, and clear communication. About The Day-to-day Execute daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual Excel‑based reports. Consolidate internal and external data files, applying templates and macros to produce final outputs. Review incoming data for completeness and accuracy, flag discrepancies, and escalate issues as needed. Identify data irregularities and proactively escalate discrepancies to the team to ensure accuracy prior to report distribution. Serve as the first point of contact for inquiries through the team inbox—communicating with internal stakeholders and external data partners. Monitor for missing, incomplete, or delayed data files and initiate timely follow‑up to maintain reporting accuracy and deadlines. Work with sensitive customers and account‑level information (PII) and uphold strict confidentiality standards. About The Qualifications 1–2+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, or a related field. Completion of a post‑secondary program in Data Analytics, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field. Intermediate experience working in Excel, with a solid foundation in formulas, data manipulation, and navigating spreadsheets. Exposure to mortgage lending, loan servicing, or banking products (retail lending, deposits, etc.) considered an asset. Prior experience working with large datasets, operational reporting, or data validation. Strong time‑management and organizational skills. Demonstrates strong attention to detail and maintains a consistently high standard of quality in all work. Ability to work both independently and within a highly collaborative team. Comfort working with confidential or sensitive information while upholding data privacy expectations. About Us Peoples Group is a trusted financial services company for the innovators at the forefront of Canada’s economic future. With offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Montreal, we are driving change by working alongside challenger banks, fintechs, brokers, and merchants to foster a dynamic and competitive financial ecosystem. Our culture is built on four core behaviors: Grit to Grow , Connect to Collaborate , Putting Clients First , and Owning the Outcome . We believe people do not simply choose a company to work for—they choose a company that makes a positive impact in the lives of Canadians. Above all, we value people, build meaningful relationships, focus on individual strengths, and approach our work with passion. About The Work Environment Peoples Group offers a flexible and hybrid work environment. In this role you will work a combination of in-office and remotely from home. Typically, you'll be working regular business hours, Monday to Friday between 8:00am and 4:30pm with flexibility around start/end times. We Offer A hybrid work environment, enabling you to balance your personal and professional life seamlessly. A competitive compensation package. (Remove if role has no benefits) A strengths-based approach, ensuring we work together more effectively. A commitment to your well-being in five key areas: Financial, Physical, Social, Career, and Community. Hiring Process If your application is selected, you will be invited for a first interview with one of our Talent Acquisition Business Partners. Depending on the role, interviews may be conducted virtually or in-person. The hiring team will communicate any in-person requirements throughout the process. job_description_formatted:
We are hiring for this position out of our Toronto office. Successful candidates who apply outside of these areas will be expected to relocate and reside in a location that is within a commutable distance. This job posting is for an existing vacancy.

This is a 14-month fixed contract position.

About The Role

The Jr Data Analyst supports reporting across multiple lending portfolios including Single Family, Commercial, Consumer, ABL/Structured Finance, as well as deposit reporting. This role is key to running, validating, and distributing operational reports that are widely used across the organization. You’ll work closely with internal teams and external partners, ensuring data accuracy, timely delivery, and clear communication.

About The Day-to-day

  • Execute daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual Excel‑based reports.
  • Consolidate internal and external data files, applying templates and macros to produce final outputs.
  • Review incoming data for completeness and accuracy, flag discrepancies, and escalate issues as needed.
  • Identify data irregularities and proactively escalate discrepancies to the team to ensure accuracy prior to report distribution.
  • Serve as the first point of contact for inquiries through the team inbox—communicating with internal stakeholders and external data partners.
  • Monitor for missing, incomplete, or delayed data files and initiate timely follow‑up to maintain reporting accuracy and deadlines.
  • Work with sensitive customers and account‑level information (PII) and uphold strict confidentiality standards.

About The Qualifications

  • 1–2+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, or a related field.
  • Completion of a post‑secondary program in Data Analytics, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Intermediate experience working in Excel, with a solid foundation in formulas, data manipulation, and navigating spreadsheets.
  • Exposure to mortgage lending, loan servicing, or banking products (retail lending, deposits, etc.) considered an asset.
  • Prior experience working with large datasets, operational reporting, or data validation.
  • Strong time‑management and organizational skills.
  • Demonstrates strong attention to detail and maintains a consistently high standard of quality in all work.
  • Ability to work both independently and within a highly collaborative team.
  • Comfort working with confidential or sensitive information while upholding data privacy expectations.

About Us

Peoples Group is a trusted financial services company for the innovators at the forefront of Canada’s economic future. With offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Montreal, we are driving change by working alongside challenger banks, fintechs, brokers, and merchants to foster a dynamic and competitive financial ecosystem.

Our culture is built on four core behaviors: Grit to Grow, Connect to Collaborate, Putting Clients First, and Owning the Outcome. We believe people do not simply choose a company to work for—they choose a company that makes a positive impact in the lives of Canadians. Above all, we value people, build meaningful relationships, focus on individual strengths, and approach our work with passion.

About The Work Environment

Peoples Group offers a flexible and hybrid work environment. In this role you will work a combination of in-office and remotely from home. Typically, you'll be working regular business hours, Monday to Friday between 8:00am and 4:30pm with flexibility around start/end times.

We Offer

  • A hybrid work environment, enabling you to balance your personal and professional life seamlessly.
  • A competitive compensation package. (Remove if role has no benefits)
  • A strengths-based approach, ensuring we work together more effectively.
  • A commitment to your well-being in five key areas: Financial, Physical, Social, Career, and Community.

Hiring Process

If your application is selected, you will be invited for a first interview with one of our Talent Acquisition Business Partners. Depending on the role, interviews may be conducted virtually or in-person. The hiring team will communicate any in-person requirements throughout the process.

Compensation

The expected salary for this role is approximately $55,000.00 - $65,000.00 annually. Actual compensation may vary based on experience, skills, and qualifications.

NOTE: This job posting is for an existing vacancy. Peoples Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest; however, only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.

We value and celebrate individuality while fostering an inclusive workplace for everyone. If there's any way we can support or accommodate you during the selection process, please don't hesitate to let us know.

Our mission is to empower developers and system architects to rapidly design and deploy cutting-edge solutions using advanced FPGA and SoC technologies. The High Level Synthesis (HLS) team at Altera specializes in creating sophisticated tools and compiler technologies that translate high-level programming languages into efficient hardware implementations. Join us and help shape the future of HLS, enabling faster innovation in fields such as AI, cloud computing, and embedded systems. Responsibilities Assist in the development and maintenance of HLS compiler infrastructure. Support the implementation of compiler passes and code transformations to optimize high-level code for hardware synthesis. Analyze and improve compilation flow from C/C++ to hardware description languages. Research in cutting edge compiler technology for AI computation workload Help integrate and test new features in HLS compilers, focusing on performance and resource optimization. Participate in debugging and validating compiler outputs. Document work and contribute to internal knowledge bases. What We Offer Mentorship and hands-on training from experienced compiler and hardware engineers. Competitive salary and benefits. Flexible work arrangements (remote or on-site). Opportunities for professional growth and advancement. Supportive and innovative work environment. Our compensation is designed to reflect the Canadian labour market. The actual salary offered may vary based on several factors, including the position’s location, as well as the candidate’s experience, skills, training, and job-specific knowledge. In addition to base salary, we offer performance-based incentive opportunities that reward both individual contributions and overall company success. Canadian work experience is not required for this role. Familiarity with compiler concepts (parsing, code generation, optimization) through coursework or personal projects. Exposure to digital logic design fundamentals and hardware flows (FPGA/ASIC) Preferred Qualifications Eagerness to learn about HLS compilers and hardware synthesis. job_description_formatted:
Job Details

Job Description:

About Us

Altera is at the forefront of programmable logic and hardware acceleration. Our mission is to empower developers and system architects to rapidly design and deploy cutting-edge solutions using advanced FPGA and SoC technologies. The High Level Synthesis (HLS) team at Altera specializes in creating sophisticated tools and compiler technologies that translate high-level programming languages into efficient hardware implementations. Join us and help shape the future of HLS, enabling faster innovation in fields such as AI, cloud computing, and embedded systems.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in the development and maintenance of HLS compiler infrastructure.
  • Support the implementation of compiler passes and code transformations to optimize high-level code for hardware synthesis.
  • Analyze and improve compilation flow from C/C++ to hardware description languages.
  • Research in cutting edge compiler technology for AI computation workload
  • Help integrate and test new features in HLS compilers, focusing on performance and resource optimization.
  • Participate in debugging and validating compiler outputs.
  • Document work and contribute to internal knowledge bases.

What We Offer

  • Mentorship and hands-on training from experienced compiler and hardware engineers.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.
  • Flexible work arrangements (remote or on-site).
  • Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.
  • Supportive and innovative work environment.

Our compensation is designed to reflect the Canadian labour market. The actual salary offered may vary based on several factors, including the position’s location, as well as the candidate’s experience, skills, training, and job-specific knowledge. In addition to base salary, we offer performance-based incentive opportunities that reward both individual contributions and overall company success.

Estimated Salary Range: $73,000 - $105,700 CAD

We use artificial intelligence to screen, assess, or select applicants for the position. This posting is for an existing vacancy. Canadian work experience is not required for this role.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field with 3+ years of experience in the following skills:

  • Academic or project experience with C/C++ programming.
  • Familiarity with compiler concepts (parsing, code generation, optimization) through coursework or personal projects.
  • Exposure to digital logic design fundamentals and hardware flows (FPGA/ASIC)

Preferred Qualifications

  • Eagerness to learn about HLS compilers and hardware synthesis.
  • Good analytical, communication, and teamwork skills.
  • Coursework or internship experience in compiler development or hardware synthesis.
  • Familiarity with MLIR, LLVM, or Clang.
  • Exposure to HLS tools (e.g., Xilinx Vivado HLS, Intel HLS).
  • Basic understanding of hardware description languages (Verilog/VHDL).
  • Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).

Job Type

Regular

Shift

Shift 1 (Canada)

Primary Location:

Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Additional Locations:

Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.

job_description_formatted:
The Client Services Analyst is responsible for providing high levels of sales support to the YouGov Canada sales team and client servicing for a specific group of clients. You will be responsible for delivering against renewal and ensuring clients are achieving the most from their subscriptions.

This role will require you to physically be in the office on a regular basis during the first few months to learn the job and the culture; but there will be some flexibility in terms of days at the office vs. at home.

As a member of the YouGov Canada team, you will:

  • Provide servicing to YouGov data product clients
  • Teach and assist clients in learning YouGov products to complete analytics
  • Conduct analysis and create reports using the YouGov database and client data as required
  • Be directly responsible for client satisfaction and engagement for specific Data Products clients, driving client retention
  • Create short form analytics for marketing of YouGov Canada
  • Support YouGov Canada sales leads and work with the YouGov Canada Team to help uncover opportunities for account growth

What’s in it for you?

  • Working for a Global industry leader in insight driven connected data solutions.
  • Being part of an exciting, fast-paced environment within a growing business
  • A great team culture, working alongside a talented team of research consultants
  • Working directly with some of the biggest Canadian and Global brands; demonstrating how to leverage our data to answer key business questions
  • Opportunities to demonstrate creativity, innovation and build successful research solutions
  • Exposure to career opportunities in Canada and around the world with a world class company

Demonstrated Knowledge And Experience

  • Very comfortable and proficient working with data and data analytics
  • Ability to uncover and articulate insights from data that align with our clients’ goals and research needs and build PowerPoint decks that deliver these insights for a business audience
  • Must possess problem-solving skills using deductive reasoning and understanding
  • Strong analytic and critical thinking skills
  • Good interpersonal skills

Technical Skills And Qualifications

  • Experience working in client facing market research is an asset
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office products
  • Proficiency working with data analytics software (e.g. SPSS, Python, R)
  • Experience working with data visualization software is an asset (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)

Behavioural competencies

  • Strong presentation and communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills, reliable and capacity to prioritize
  • Excellent writing skills for a business audience
  • Detail oriented who can also multi-task, handling many different projects
  • Quick learner
  • Adaptability and willing to embrace new challenges

Why join YouGov?

Join our global team to help us achieve our social mission: to make millions of people’s opinions heard for the benefit of our local, national, and international communities.

Understanding diversity of opinion requires diversity of background. Although our global panel of millions of people worldwide powers our research, our biggest asset is our people. If our research is to be truly representative of what the world thinks, we need people from all walks of life to be part of the team to bring their perspective to the work we do.

Life at YouGov

We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless, and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics, and proven methodologies. We respect and trust each other, bringing these values into everything that we do.

We strive to provide YouGovers with best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing. We want our employees to have a sense of belonging and uniqueness in a supportive workplace, so they can bring their full selves to work.

Equal Opportunity Employer

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity or expression, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, HIV status, political affiliation, socioeconomic background, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law or in line with our responsibilities as a fair and ethic employer. All employment decisions are made based on occupational qualifications, merit, and business need.

Data Privacy

To find out how we collect and use your personal data when you apply for a role at YouGov, please read our privacy notice at https://jobs.yougov.com/privacy

job_summary: Job description: Job Description Job Description: We are looking for a highly skilled Linux Systems Developer with expertise in software compilation , C++ development , and PostgreSQL . This role involves building and optimizing custom software for Linux environments, integrating with mainframe systems, and supporting application deployments. The ideal candidate will also collaborate with vendors, manage SOPs, and participate in both non-production and production releases. Roles & Responsibilities Development & Compilation Design and develop Linux applications using C++ and POSIX APIs. Customize and maintain build systems (Makefiles, CMake) for complex software compilation. Perform cross-compilation for hybrid environments (Linux ↔ mainframe). Optimize binaries for performance, memory usage, and reliability. Implement database logic and optimize queries in PostgreSQL (PL/pgSQL, indexing, query tuning). Mainframe Integration Work with z/OS UNIX System Services (USS) for POSIX-compliant code execution. Integrate Linux applications with CICS , IMS , and TableBase for transaction and data flows. Handle EBCDIC ↔ ASCII conversions and ensure data integrity across platforms. Application Support & Operations Provide application support for production and non-production environments. Collaborate with vendors for issue resolution, patches, and upgrades. Maintain and update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for operational tasks. Participate in deployment activities , including validation and rollback planning. Monitor application health and troubleshoot performance issues. DevOps & Automation Work with CI/CD pipelines for Linux and mainframe integration. Automate build, deployment, and monitoring processes using Shell/Python scripting . Ensure compliance with security standards and operational best practices. Required Skills Strong proficiency in C++ (modern standards), STL, multi-threading, and memory management. Expertise in Linux system programming (POSIX APIs, IPC, signals). Hands-on experience with GNU toolchain (gcc, g++, ld, make, CMake). job_description_formatted:
Job description:

Job Description

Job Description:

We are looking for a highly skilled Linux Systems Developer with expertise in software compilation, C++ development, and PostgreSQL. This role involves building and optimizing custom software for Linux environments, integrating with mainframe systems, and supporting application deployments. The ideal candidate will also collaborate with vendors, manage SOPs, and participate in both non-production and production releases.

Roles & Responsibilities

Development & Compilation

  • Design and develop Linux applications using C++ and POSIX APIs.
  • Customize and maintain build systems (Makefiles, CMake) for complex software compilation.
  • Perform cross-compilation for hybrid environments (Linux ↔ mainframe).
  • Optimize binaries for performance, memory usage, and reliability.
  • Implement database logic and optimize queries in PostgreSQL (PL/pgSQL, indexing, query tuning).

Mainframe Integration

  • Work with z/OS UNIX System Services (USS) for POSIX-compliant code execution.
  • Integrate Linux applications with CICS, IMS, and TableBase for transaction and data flows.
  • Handle EBCDIC ↔ ASCII conversions and ensure data integrity across platforms.

Application Support & Operations

  • Provide application support for production and non-production environments.
  • Collaborate with vendors for issue resolution, patches, and upgrades.
  • Maintain and update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for operational tasks.
  • Participate in deployment activities, including validation and rollback planning.
  • Monitor application health and troubleshoot performance issues.

DevOps & Automation

  • Work with CI/CD pipelines for Linux and mainframe integration.
  • Automate build, deployment, and monitoring processes using Shell/Python scripting.
  • Ensure compliance with security standards and operational best practices.

Required Skills

  • Strong proficiency in C++ (modern standards), STL, multi-threading, and memory management.
  • Expertise in Linux system programming (POSIX APIs, IPC, signals).
  • Hands-on experience with GNU toolchain (gcc, g++, ld, make, CMake).
  • Knowledge of PostgreSQL (schema design, query optimization, PL/pgSQL).
  • Familiarity with cross-compilation and hybrid architecture builds.
  • Experience with mainframe integration (CICS, IMS, TableBase).
  • Debugging and profiling tools: gdb, strace, perf, valgrind.
  • Strong scripting skills in Shell and Python.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience with z/Linux (Linux on IBM Z).
  • Familiarity with containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
  • Understanding of RACF/ACF2 security models.
 

 

Experience: 3-5 Years
.

 

The expected compensation for this role ranges from CAD 57000 to CAD 90000 .

 

Reinvent your world. We are building a modern Wipro. We are an end-to-end digital transformation partner with the boldest ambitions. To realize them, we need people inspired by reinvention. Of yourself, your career, and your skills. We want to see the constant evolution of our business and our industry. It has always been in our DNA - as the world around us changes, so do we. Join a business powered by purpose and a place that empowers you to design your own reinvention.

 

Wipro is committed to creating an accessible, supportive, and inclusive workplace. Reasonable accommodation will be provided to all applicants including persons with disabilities, throughout the recruitment and selection process. Accommodations must be communicated in advance of the application, where possible, and will be reviewed on an individual basis. Wipro provides equal opportunities to all and values diversity.

Position Description

This role is hybrid and requires you to be at a Client office at a minimum 2 days per week - subject to change at any time.

We are seeking an experienced End-to-End Test Lead to manage and oversee testing activities across complex technology portfolios. This role requires strong expertise in test strategy, planning, execution, and stakeholder communication to ensure high-quality delivery.

Your future duties and responsibilities

  • Develop and implement end-to-end test strategies for multiple applications and integrated systems.
  • Lead test planning, execution, defect management, and release testing activities.
  • Monitor and report on testing progress, risks, and issues across projects.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including development, business analysts, and project managers, to ensure alignment on testing objectives.
  • Provide insights and recommendations based on test results to improve quality and reduce risk.
  • Utilize tools such as HP ALM, JIRA, and automation frameworks for test management and reporting.
  • Ensure compliance with organizational standards and best practices in testing.
  • Mentor and guide junior testers and coordinate with offshore/onshore teams as needed.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

  • Proven experience in end-to-end test management for large-scale, complex technology portfolios.
  • Strong knowledge of test planning, execution, defect reporting, and release testing.
  • Hands-on experience with HP ALM, JIRA, and automation tools.
  • Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
  • Ability to oversee cross-functional testing efforts and manage dependencies across multiple applications.
  • Domain expertise in banking or financial systems is highly preferred.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience in Agile and DevOps environments.
  • Knowledge of regulatory compliance testing in financial services.
  • Familiarity with performance and security testing concepts.

**CGI is providing a reasonable estimate of the pay range for this role. The determination of this range includes factors such as skill set level, geographic market, experience and training, and licenses and certifications. Compensation decisions depend on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $80,000–$130,000. This role is an existing vacancy.**

job_summary: Job Description What to expect Optimize digital buy-flows and sales funnels through comprehensive analysis of user behavior, leveraging multiple data sources including click-level tracking, user surveys, and transactional metrics to enhance conversion rates and service effectiveness. Plan, execute, analyze and socialize mixed methods generative research to support strategic initiatives. Collect and analyze digital experience data using on-site surveys (e.g., SEQ) to identify improvement opportunities and share results with Content, Product and Design teams. Automate and democratize UX research by developing custom tools (Python, R) and creating educational materials and documentation. Lead the development, facilitation, and analysis of user testing initiatives to capture feedback on both project-specific and broader journey experience. Participate in Agile rituals and work effectively within a Kanban process framework. Work collaboratively with UX/UI Design and Digital Product teams to support ongoing initiatives. What you bring University Degree or College Diploma, or equivalent work experience 2+ years’ experience in UX Research, with a portfolio that demonstrates end-to-end ownership of generative and evaluative studies across complex digital products and services. Experience collaborating cross-functionally with Content design, UX, product, Business, and Customer Journey/Service Design teams within Agile frameworks. Ability to distill complex findings into clear, actionable insights and advocate for users through compelling storytelling that drives real product impact. Experience with e-commerce and digital buy-flow optimization, including identifying and reducing friction in key conversion paths. Proficient in mixed-methods research — from qualitative interviews and usability testing to quantitative analysis, including survey design, A/B testing, and advanced statistical techniques. Comfortable coding in R or Python to analyze large datasets, automate research workflows, and scale insights across teams. Experience leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) with a focus on ethical implementation and maintaining human oversight throughout the process. Skilled at evaluating interaction design and usability through task-based testing, heuristic reviews, and behavioral analysis. Confident in assessing content clarity through comprehension testing — ensuring labels, content, and terminology are intuitive and user-friendly. Proficient in information architecture methods such as card sorting and tree testing to validate navigation and content organization. Experience exploring tone, visual appeal, and emotional resonance through surveys, preference testing, and design feedback sessions. Extensive experience with remote user testing platforms (e.g., UserTesting.com, UserZoom) to efficiently recruit participants and conduct moderated/unmoderated studies at scale. Proficient with digital experience analytics tools (e.g., FullStory, Content Square) for session replay analysis, heatmap generation, and funnel visualization to identify UX issues and opportunities. Experience with customer feedback and survey platforms (e.g., VWO, Medallia, Qualtrics) to collect, analyze and act on user insights through various touchpoints, with a focus on survey design and analysis. job_description_formatted:
Job Description

 What to expect

  • Optimize digital buy-flows and sales funnels through comprehensive analysis of user behavior, leveraging multiple data sources including click-level tracking, user surveys, and transactional metrics to enhance conversion rates and service effectiveness.
  • Plan, execute, analyze and socialize mixed methods generative research to support strategic initiatives.
  • Collect and analyze digital experience data using on-site surveys (e.g., SEQ) to identify improvement opportunities and share results with Content, Product and Design teams.
  • Automate and democratize UX research by developing custom tools (Python, R) and creating educational materials and documentation.
  • Lead the development, facilitation, and analysis of user testing initiatives to capture feedback on both project-specific and broader journey experience.
  • Participate in Agile rituals and work effectively within a Kanban process framework.
  • Work collaboratively with UX/UI Design and Digital Product teams to support ongoing initiatives.

What you bring

  • University Degree or College Diploma, or equivalent work experience
  • 2+ years’ experience in UX Research, with a portfolio that demonstrates end-to-end ownership of generative and evaluative studies across complex digital products and services.
  • Experience collaborating cross-functionally with Content design, UX, product, Business, and Customer Journey/Service Design teams within Agile frameworks.
  • Ability to distill complex findings into clear, actionable insights and advocate for users through compelling storytelling that drives real product impact.
  • Experience with e-commerce and digital buy-flow optimization, including identifying and reducing friction in key conversion paths.
  • Proficient in mixed-methods research — from qualitative interviews and usability testing to quantitative analysis, including survey design, A/B testing, and advanced statistical techniques.
  • Comfortable coding in R or Python to analyze large datasets, automate research workflows, and scale insights across teams.
  • Experience leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) with a focus on ethical implementation and maintaining human oversight throughout the process.
  • Skilled at evaluating interaction design and usability through task-based testing, heuristic reviews, and behavioral analysis.
  • Confident in assessing content clarity through comprehension testing — ensuring labels, content, and terminology are intuitive and user-friendly.
  • Proficient in information architecture methods such as card sorting and tree testing to validate navigation and content organization.
  • Experience exploring tone, visual appeal, and emotional resonance through surveys, preference testing, and design feedback sessions.
  • Extensive experience with remote user testing platforms (e.g., UserTesting.com, UserZoom) to efficiently recruit participants and conduct moderated/unmoderated studies at scale.
  • Proficient with digital experience analytics tools (e.g., FullStory, Content Square) for session replay analysis, heatmap generation, and funnel visualization to identify UX issues and opportunities.
  • Experience with customer feedback and survey platforms (e.g., VWO, Medallia, Qualtrics) to collect, analyze and act on user insights through various touchpoints, with a focus on survey design and analysis.

Salary Range: $73,500 - $123,500

About Us

Actual salary for the role may vary depending on work location of the successful candidate and other factors including but not limited to, skills, education, experience, working conditions and the local labour market.

This position is being posted to fill an existing vacancy.

We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.

Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting accessibility@economical.com.

Background checks

This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).

About The Team

Definity is the parent company to some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative property and casualty insurers. We can’t do that without our people, so we embrace and encourage a culture that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.

We offer a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Bring your true self and be a part of our journey. It’s better here.

job_description_formatted:
Position Description

This role is hybrid and requires you to be at our downtown Toronto office at a minimum 2 days per week - subject to change at any time.

The Technical Lead – ECRM serves as a key liaison between business, technical, and product teams, driving the design, development, and deployment of Contact Centre solutions in ECRM. This role combines system analysis, full-stack development, and leadership to deliver modern solutions, enabling efficient customer interactions and enhancing operational performance. The Tech Lead is responsible for ensuring architectural excellence, technical innovation, and business alignment throughout the end to end delivery of the ECRM program.

Your future duties and responsibilities

  • Lead the design, development, and deployment of ECRM, Salesforce, Azure, Desktop, Reporting Solutions.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate goals into system and functional requirements.
  • Architect and design modern processes to replace legacy applications.
  • Oversee system integrations between Salesforce, Azure, APIs, Desktop and Databases.
  • Provide hands-on leadership across development, testing, and implementation of End to End solution.
  • Guide teams through all stages of the SDLC — from requirements to production support.
  • Conduct feasibility analysis and ensure system designs align with technical standards and business outcomes.
  • Manage cross-functional workshops for requirements elicitation, process mapping, and technical validation.
  • Perform troubleshooting, performance optimization, and production support for complex systems.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems.
  • 8+ years of professional experience in software engineering and system analysis.
  • 5+ years of hands-on experience in Conversational AI, NLP/NLU, and automation domains.
  • Proven experience with Salesforce, Azure, APIs, Desktop Integration and Databases.
  • Strong background in cloud ecosystems (Azure, GCP, AWS).
  • Experience in leading or mentoring development teams and managing end-to-end project delivery.

Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to translate business needs into system architecture and design.
  • Expertise in Azure, Salesforce, REST APIs, and systems integrations.
  • Knowledge of system integrations with Salesforce, and contact center technologies.
  • Hands-on experience with Waterfall and Agile/Scrum methodologies.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Familiarity with data modeling, system design, and SDLC best practices.

Certifications (preferred but not required):

  • Azure AI Certifications
  • Agile / Scrum Master
  • Cloud Certifications (Azure, AWS, or GCP)

Core Competencies:

  • AI system architecture and design thinking
